properties.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
properties.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 12 at 3:19AM AKST until January 13 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills expected. The dangerously
cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10
minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 20
below zero to 65 below zero.

* WHERE...Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country.

* WHEN...Now to noon Monday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will increase today in the Upper
Yukon River with winds gusting to 25 mph.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and
sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create dangerously
low wind chill values. Frost bite can occur quickly and even
hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST MONDAY
